gco:CharacterString.#text: UMR Centre d'Ecologie Fonctionnelle et Evolutive (CEFE)
UMR Centre d'Ecologie Fonctionnelle et Evolutive (CEFE)
Population ecology observatory (ECOPOP) : Observation Service of the Montpellier Research Observatory of Environment (OSU OREME)

Data from the 'Population ecology observatory' (ECOPOP): Individual monitoring of wild animals: physical, biological, social environment, genetic, physiological, immunological, behavioral data.. This observatory is part of the Montpellier Research Observatory of Environment (OSU OREME, oreme.org). It consists in different observing tasks: African ungulates ; Albatross ; Arctic marine ecosystems ; Black-headed Gull ; Black-legged Kittiwake ; Cape gannets ; Contact areas between striated mouse species ; Dynamics of Camargue vertebrate populations ; Ecology and sociality in chacma baboons ; Griffon Vultures ; Kestrel falcon ; Larus michahellis Yellow-legged Gull  ; Mandrillus project ; Northern gannets ; Scopoli's Shearwater ; Sociable weavers ; Tits.
UMR Centre d'Ecologie Fonctionnelle et Evolutive (CEFE)

Commission Regulation (EU) No 1089/2010 of 23 November 2010 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards interoperability of spatial data sets and services
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1205/2008 of 3 December 2008 implementing Directive 2007/2/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards metadata

Measurements: Albatrosses and pathogens in Subantarctic observing task: Eco-epidemiology data ; Albatrosses and pathogens in Subantarctic observing task: Eco-epidemiology data, notably the annual proportion of yellow-nosed albatrosses exposed to Pasteurella multocida, breeding success and adult survival ; Albatrosses and pathogens in Subantarctic observing task: Eco-epidemiology data, notably the local annual proportion of brown skuas exposed to Pasteurella multocida and movements of brown skuas ; Behavior and demography of african ungulates observing task: Demographic monitoring (survival, reproduction) of selected species (giraffe, zebra, wildebeest, elephants). Space use monitoring using GPS collars (zebras, wildebeest, elephants). ; Contact areas between striated mouse species (Rhabdomys sp.): windows on climate change and adaptation in southern Africa observing task: CMR, morphometric meeasurements ; Dispersion and operation of subdivided populations: Black-headed Gull model observing task: Colony size (breeding pairs) ; Indice of Breeding success ; Caracterization of vegetation cover ; Food procurement strategy and dynamics of distribution at sea: Scopoli's Shearwater model observing task: Individual movements, stable isotopic analyses, measurement ; Food procurement strategy and dynamics of distribution at sea: Scopoli's Shearwater model observing task: Reproduction monitoring, individual marking, individual movements, stable isotopic analyses, measurement ; Life history traits of birds, and population responses to global change: the case of tits observing task: Reproduction: laying dates, clutch size, number of flown chicks, local recruitment ; Individuals condition: energy balance, chicks and adults weight and morphometry ; Demographic parameters with adult capture / recapture methods:  density, survival, dispersion (as estimated by the study of gene flow) ; Number of parasites: Protocalliphora spp on chicks, avian malaria prevalence in adults ; Reproduction conditions: vegetation and arthropods (caterpillars) phenology, local temperature ; Long-term self-centered and population-based follow-ups of a social group of wild mandrills in Gabon observing task: Daily behavioral and demographic observations ; Ecophysiological measurements ; Monitoring the population dynamics and movements of Falco naumanni kestrels in the south of France observing task: Monitoring of breeding parameters, GPS telemetry ; Monitoring the population dynamics and movements of Falco naumanni kestrels in the south of France observing task: Monitoring of breeding parameters, ringing of chicks, visual resighting of adult birds, GPS telemetry ; Movement and population dynamics of griffon vultures in response to changes in rendering practices in the Causses observing task: Reproduction monitoring, individual marking, individual movements ; Population spatial ecology: Black-legged Kittiwake model and parasites observing task: Breeding success, exposure of birds to parasites and microparasites, individual movements ; Population spatial ecology: Larus michahellis Yellow-legged Gull and pathogens observing task: Proportion of nests containing antibodies against different infectious agents ; Reproduction, survival, cooperation and coloring of sociable weavers in semi-desert (South Africa) observing task: Morphometric and colorimetric measurements, blood sampling and bandaging, monitoring reproductive phenology, measures of sociality and cooperation ; Self-centered monitoring of three groups of chacma baboons (Papio ursinus) in Namibia observing task: Daily behavioral and demographic observations ; Genetic, hormonal and isotopic  analyses ; GPS movement tracking ; monthly phenological monitoring
